ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: The course needs to be structured better, with more classes focussed on core theory.

The course is developed in a seminar-like manner, with most of the work student driven. Learning is developed by means of the development of the questionnare, and assessment to Diplomats. Thus, the level of effort that each student invest in the class can change the evaluation of the overall course
Very different and interesting approach to a class; I really learned more about how to do a proper research and will be able to take a greater leading roile in the future when facig similar projects.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: This class was very hands-on, providing a learning experience like no other. Most importantly, this class provided me the opportunity to really make and difference by reaching out to diplomats and formulating substantive policymaking recommendations for climate change negotiations. I believe that students learn best when they really have the opportunity to work in the field and see the results of their work. This course enables exactly that. There is so much more that can be learned from this kind of hands-on experience than just reading readings or textbook chapters.
The interviews with the UN Diplomats
The possiblity of getting hands on experience in diplomacy, by participating as part member negotiatior in a COP
I liked that the course is run like a discussion and a UN simulation. I like the practical approach that this class takes.
The fact that we went out of the box and got insight information.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Perhaps the pace of the class can be sped up a bit more. Sometimes, it seemed that the progress was a bit slow and affected the timeline of the class a bit.
The class material, needs to be better prepared and structure.
Timming, and focus on class time. The class might have had benefit of ending the questionnare earlier, and focus on UN interviews
Less time for survey preparation.
Have faster pace.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: The relationship was very effective. Class was focused on questionnaire improvement techniques and relevant discussion topics. No complaints.
It was alright, but needed to be more engaging.
I think the course is very relevant to every day happenings and also to all discussions and presentations.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I am extremely interested in climate change policy and have worked at the UN for a year now for the Republic of Seychelles. The course provided me with the hands-on experience I needed and deepened my interviewing and negotiating skills, as well as informing me of diplomatic language. This course, therefore, taught me the real skills I need to succeed in the field.

The course presented a global view, of some hot environmental issues, focusing in particular in climate change. As such it allowed me to better understand different positions, and how to target the responsibles of desicion making

I am an International Rlations major so the diplomacy of environment is a very important and growing field that shows all of the intricacies related to very important diplomatic issues, not only environmentally-related.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I took this course because it offered me the hands-on experience that I sought. The perspective and real life experience that the class offer is like none other, and I did not want to pass up taking this one of a kind class.
To expand the view on how diplomatic negotiations are done, and how techincal knowledge is incorporated at high end strategic negotiation
I wanted to learn more about environmental and sustainability issues and have the opportunity to learn about current events in the area as well.
Because I wanted a course that would be too different from the others and from which I could produce knowledge.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Definitely, and even surpassed my expectations. I learned not only some of the important real life skills I wanted to get from the class, but also skills involving group work, diplomatic language and negotiations.
Not really. I expected to learn a lot more about the negotiations process at the UN
Yes
Yes.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: The advantages of group work were that different opinions on the issues were heard and that different angles of tackling questions were allowed. This made constructive dialogue that made constructing the questionnaire for diplomats more focused. The disadvantage was that the dialogue took time and were perhaps a bit more inefficient than individual work.

The classas a whole is developed in a group basis, and team work is also encouraged in the interview process - The diversity of backgrounds and skills contribute to make things easier (e.g overpass language barriers)

Working in a group is a great experience as you learn a lot about how things function in a team. Additionally, you learn about the challenges and how to overcome these. The disadvantages are basically issue of resolving disagreement and often spending excess time on issues that don't arise when you work independently.
It depends on the dyamics. Here particularly it was very useful becuase we could use different advantages of students on the same way we would on real life and we were specialized on something.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Definitely take this class if you would like to learn the real hands-on experience, a perspective that few courses offer. This class is competitive to get into, and you will be expected to work hard, but the payoff is totally worth it.
Work on creating a questionnaire at the beginning of the semester, so that there is more time to schedule and conduct interviews.
The class is a very accuarate model of the UN methodology. It will demand a lot of negotiation and consensus among peers.
I would recommend it.

I would advise you tot ake it if interested in beingpart of a research group that involves commitment and on which you will have a heavy responsibility of producing the key questions; also interesting if you want to see ossues related to diplomcy in general.
